main event: A radar UFO sighting was reported in Las Vegas, Nevada, on 3rd July 1957, and the object was tracked on ground radar, abruptly stopped, and remained stationary for two minutes.
interesting points: The object's behavior was reported as unusual and unidentified, with rapid movement speeds of 1200 - 1800 MPH and abrupt changes in direction.
The sighting was observed by reliable radar operators and was deemed unidentifiable due to its exceptional performance.
A brilliant bluish white light traveling at an average speed of 525 MPH was observed, traveling in an erratic and winding course before disappearing from sight.
A cellophane-wrapped weather report and exact location details were noted, and the object was described as being about 51'4" in diameter and rapidly maneuverable.
The report indicates that the radar sighting was of extreme speed, eliminating the possibility of it being a normal aircraft, and was deemed unsatisfactorily explained due to lack of sufficient data.
sighted object: unidentified object tracked on ground radar
